result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Hearing on June 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:03 AM Cases called: 21CF738 and 22CF20. Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Robert A. Reick appeared by video, in custody at Stanley Correctional. Court advised the defendant of his rights. Defendant stated he has been trying to call the SPD office, and they have not been returning his phone calls. JA had called the SPD prior to this hearing and they stated they are still trying to find someone to represent the defendant, he is eligible. Court questioned the defendant on how he would like to proceed. He had filed a request for prompt disposition. Defendant stated he is willing to proceed prose. Defendant requested a court appointed attorney. Would like the trial to remain. Court will try to find an attorney to represent the defendant. Defendant would not be opposed to a reset of the trial date if someone is appointed and can not be available for the trial date as it currently is set as long as the date would be soon. Court will hold a new hearing if an attorney is found and there is a scheduling conflict. There will need to be a preliminary hearing on 21CF738 once an attorney is appointed. 11:09 AM

Preliminary hearing on February 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Robert A. Reick appeared in court, in custody from the Columbia County Jail. Right to atty recited, Defendant states Atty Riek will be his counsel on this matter, Court states the Public Defender's Office confirmed that Atty Riek will be appointed, Defendant states he is not waiving time limits to prelim and would like to proceed, Court reviews with defendant his right to counsel, Defendant would like to proceed with counsel, waives time limits to prelim, Court accepts Waiver, Atty Yaskal and Atty Riek to contact the Br. 3 JA for rescheduling of the Preliminary Hearing, 1:31 P.M.

Standard felony conditions. No contact with J.A.R. or K.R.K. their residences, schools, work places or immediate families. No contact with any children under the age of 18. No contact with Nicole Brue.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
